text: John "Jackie" Gordon (March 3, 1928 â€“ June 27, 2022) was a Canadian ice hockey manager, coach and player. Gordon played 36 games in the National Hockey League with the New York Rangers from 1946 to 1961. He was also head coach of the Minnesota North Stars from 1970 to 1973. He also was a general manager of the North Stars from 1974 to 1978 and of the Vancouver Canucks from 1985 to 1987. Gordon was born in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. He died on June 27, 2022 at the age of 94.John Gordon obituary ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2022 deaths Category:New York Rangers players Category:Canadian ice hockey coaches Category:Ice hockey people from Manitoba Category:Sportspeople from Winnipeg
title: Jack Gordon (ice hockey)
